commodity.name: Food
commodity.description: Evolving from the military rations of centuries past, modern packaged meals are rich in nutrients and able to last decades in their vacuum-sealed packaging.

commodity.name: Ore
commodity.description: Ore is a key material in many industries. Smelted into metals, without ore, the ship-building industry and many others would grind to a halt.

commodity.name: Gold
commodity.description: Despite its limited use in industry, gold has a relative high value due to its role as an universal currency.

commodity.name: Diamond
commodity.description: Diamonds are formed in massive telluric planets, deep under the ground, by the high pressure. In the past, diamonds used to be very expensive due to its rarity on the surface of earth. Nowadays, artificial diamonds are so easy to produce that the prices are very low.

commodity.name: Water
commodity.description: On some desertic planets, water is quite expensive due to the high demand.

commodity.name: Industrial Goods
commodity.description: An assortment of industrial goods, ranging from cutting lasers to processed metals.

commodity.name: Medicine
commodity.description: An assortment of medicines suitable for curing all sorts of ailments.

commodity.name: Luxury Goods
commodity.description: All sorts of high quality luxury goods.
